text: I deleted my VM twice and was able to make node-sdk-unit-test each time.   'Make all' succeeds with some ostensibly minor failures.   Interestingly, since my node-sdk breakthrough, I have not had to install node-pre-gyp.   In fact:

vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0587761:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ npm list
/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric
└── (empty)

vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0587761:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ node-pre-gyp --version
node-pre-gyp: command not found
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0587761:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ node --version
v0.12.7
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0587761:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ npm --version
2.11.3
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.0.10-0587761:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$
I didn't have tu upgrade node or npm either.  I wonder what changed?
